meanings.definition: A person who has recently acquired wealth or status, but has not yet gained the social acceptance of others.
meanings.sent1: The parvenue tried to fit in with the wealthy crowd at the party.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a parvenue among the established elite of the town.
meanings.sent3: The parvenue's attempts to impress the socialites often ended in comical mishaps.
meanings.sent4: Her flashy jewelry marked her as a parvenue in the eyes of the old-money families.
meanings.sent5: The parvenue's extravagant lifestyle was a stark contrast to her humble beginnings.

meanings.sent1: She hoped to parvenue quickly after winning the lottery.
meanings.sent2: He tried to parvenue by marrying into a wealthy family.
meanings.sent3: The young entrepreneur set out to parvenue in the competitive business world.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden rise to fame made her parvenue status undeniable.
meanings.sent5: The ambitious actress aimed to parvenue in Hollywood despite the odds.
